business.headline: Indian airlines may face turbulence as Pakistan closes its skiesPakistan has announced shutting its airspace to Indian carriers as tensions rise between the two neighbours following a deadly militant attack in Indian Kashmir earlier this week.

Samsung to invest Rs 1,000 crore in Tamil Nadu plant: ReportSamsung's Tamil Nadu factory currently employs over 2,000 people. In 2022–23, the plant contributed one-fifth of Samsung's Rs 1 lakh crore sales in India.
Sensex, Nifty close lower as rising India-Pakistan tension spooks investorsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 588.80 points to end at 79,212.53, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 207.35 points to end at 24,039.35.

Pahalgam terror attack casts big shadow on Kashmir's booming tourism economyKashmir was slowly rebuilding its image as a peaceful tourist destination after years of conflict, especially after the abrogation of Article 370 in August 2019.

Sebi revises cut-off timings for overnight mutual fund redemptions. Details hereSebi aims to make sure stock brokers and clearing members use client funds wisely by investing in secure overnight mutual fund schemes (MFOS).

Air India may buy 10 Boeing planes turned down by China: ReportThe ongoing trade tensions between the US and China, marked by steep duties above 100%, have impacted various sectors, even the aviation industry has taken a hit.
Pakistan Stock Exchange portal crashes amid rising geopolitical heatThe online portal of PSX showed a message saying "We'll be back soon," indicating that the website was temporarily unavailable.

Bengaluru resident shares costly homebuying mistake: 'Don't fall for FOMO'A social media user from Bengaluru shared that he has been living in Bengaluru for the past six years. Like many others, he moved to the city for better career opportunities. Despite being financially stable, he chose to rent rather than buy a flat. But the trouble started soon after.

Sensex, Nifty tank: Indo-Pak tensions trigger market crash. Check top losersSensex plunged over 1,000 points, while Nifty tanked over 300 points, falling below 24,000 as uncertainty prevailed over geopolitical tensions.

Apple plans to make all US iPhones in India by 2026: ReportThe said move is part of Apple's long-term plan to reduce its dependence on China, especially after the recent tariff rules announced by US President Donald Trump.

Ather Energy IPO: Check latest GMP as Rs 3,000 crore public listing to open soonThe Ather Energy IPO will be a book-built issue. It consists of a fresh issue of 8.18 crore equity shares worth Rs 2,626 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 1.11 crore shares worth Rs 354.76 crore.

Sensex falls 1,000 points: Why is stock market falling today despite early gains?Sensex and Nifty plunged more than 1% reacting to uncertainty over geopolitical tensions. The S&P BSE Sensex tanked 1,026.28 points to 78,775.15, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 330.40 points to 23,916.30 as of 11:41 am.
Sensex, Nifty erase early gains as markets react to Kashmir terror attackThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 492.29 points to 79,309.14, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 172.15 points to 24,074.55 as of 10 am.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will Dalal Street return to winning ways on April 25?Stock market today: Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,522 as of 7:48 am, which is about 1.1% above Thursday's Nifty50 close of 24,246.7.

Stocks to watch today: RIL, Axis Bank, Gensol, IndusInd Bank, Maruti SuzukiReliance Industries will announce its results for the March 2025 quarter today. The market will be watching closely for updates on its energy, telecom, and retail businesses.

ED raids Gensol promoters, detains Puneet Jaggi from Delhi hotel: ReportSources said the probe agency has invoked provisions under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) following findings of fund diversion and misrepresentation flagged earlier by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi).

Pay10 becomes first entity to go live on CBUAE's open finance frameworkThe new license gives Pay10 secure, real-time access to consumer bank accounts, enabling seamless third-party financial services. This sets the foundation for broader innovations in areas such as embedded finance, digital identity, and interoperable payment systems.

Kumar Mangalam Birla to receive Lata Deenanath Mangeshkar Award 2025The 57-year-old industrialist, Padma Bhushan awardee and Chairman of the Aditya Birla Group, is being honoured for his pivotal role in shaping India's growth story.
'Wives are smarter': Harsh Goenka's gold vs gadget lesson goes viralOn April 24, at 10.30 am, gold on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) was at Rs 95,893 per 10 grams, up Rs 1,171.

Sensex, Nifty snap 7-day winning streak, HUL falls 4% after Q4 resultsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 315.06 points to 79,801.43 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 82.25 points to settle at 24,246.70.

India hits pause on Indus Waters Treaty: Could this dry up Pakistan's economy?India has suspended the Indus Waters Treaty (IWT). The announcement was made by Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri on Wednesday, a day after a deadly attack in Pahalgam killed several civilians.

Gold vs mutual funds: What should you invest in for better returns?Gold is often seen as a safe investment. When markets are shaky or inflation rises, many investors turn to gold. On the other hand, mutual funds, particularly equity funds, are linked to the stock market. When the market does well, your mutual fund investment can grow faster.

Gold prices today: Check rates in metro cities. What to expect?On the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), gold was priced at Rs 95,893 per 10 grams at 10.30 am, which was a rise of Rs 1,171 from the last close.
ITR filing 2025: Last date, refund timeline and documents. All you need to knowYou can submit your ITR for the year of assessment 2025-26 once the online portal goes live.

Middle-class stuck in debt trap, says Marcellus Investment's Saurabh MukherjeaUsing data from the Reserve Bank of India, Mukherjea estimates that 5-10% of middle-class households are now stuck in a debt trap.

Want to share UPI with family? Check steps to use BHIM app's UPI CircleUPI Circle is a feature where the main UPI account holder or the primary user can authorise up to five trusted people, i.e., secondary users to make UPI payments using his account.
Gensol says no ED notice received by company, stock continues steep fallGensol share price: The stock fell 5% to hit the lower circuit limit and has fallen over 50% in the last 6 months.

HUL Q4 profit falls 4% to Rs 2,464 crore; announces Rs 24 final dividendThe FMCG major reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 2,464 crore for the March quarter, down 3.7% from Rs 2,558 crore in the same period last year.

Explained: Why Rallis India shares tumbled over 6% after Q4 resultsThe Tata Group company posted a wider net loss of Rs 32 crore for the quarter ended March 31, 2025, compared to Rs 22 crore in the same period last year.

Saving for daughter? Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana still offers high interest. Check ratesSukanya Samriddhi Yojana not only offers high interest but also tax-free returns, thus making it one of the safest savings options for families with a girl child.

UBS upgrades stance on Indian stock markets, but finds China 'more attractive'Despite India's promising fundamentals, China remains UBS's top pick among emerging markets (EM), thanks to cheaper valuations and a stronger risk-reward profile.
Sensex, Nifty slip as investors book profit after 7-day market rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex fell by 159.23 points to 79,957.26, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 72.20 points to 24,256.75 as of 9:28 am.

ICAI to examine books of crisis-hit Gensol Engineering and BluSmartGensol Engineering and BluSmart are currently facing scrutiny after serious questions were raised about their financial dealings and governance practices.

Stock market opening: Sensex, Nifty to extend gains beyond 80,000?Sensex, Nifty expectation: Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,415.5 at 8:01 am, up 0.3% from Wednesday's Nifty50 close of 24,328.95, signalling a higher opening.

Stocks to watch on April 24: HUL, Nestle, SBI Life, Axis Bank, Adani GreenShares of HUL, Axis Bank, Tech Mahindra, Nestle, Persistent Systems and SBI Life Insurance Company will be closely watched today as the companies are set to announce their fourth quarter earnings.

From watches to antiques, these luxury goods above Rs 10 lakh face 1% TCSThe Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) has issued fresh guidelines to enforce the levy, which aims to plug tax leaks and boost visibility on big-ticket purchases.

'Operation Zeppelin' reveals details of Adani's counter to Hindenburg: ReportIn January 2023, Hindenburg published a scathing report against the Adani Group. The counter to its damning report against the conglomerate was dubbed 'Operation Zeppelin'.

European Union fines Apple $570 million, Meta $228 million under new tech lawsThe fines levied on the two American tech giants are likely to stoke tensions with US President Donald Trump, who has threatened to levy tariffs against countries that penalise US companies.

Looking for high FD rates? These banks offer interest of over 9%A few small finance banks are offering attractive interest rates, some as high as 9.10% for senior citizens. These banks are using competitive rates to draw in long-term deposits, making them a smart pick for cautious investors.
Sensex closes 520 points higher; Nifty above 24,300; HCLTech jumps 8%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 520.90 points to close at 80,116.49, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 161.50 points to end at 24,328.95.

entertainment.headline: Ajith Kumar, with son on lap, watches CSK vs SRH match in Chepauk stadiumActor Ajith Kumar attended a cricket match at Chennai's Chepauk Stadium to watch MS Dhoni in action as CSK clashes with SRH. He was present with his family.

Kull trailer: Raisingh siblings at war in Ekta Kapoor's upcoming showJioHotstar has released the trailer for 'Kull - The Legacy Of The Raisingghs'. The series, produced by Balaji Digital, will stream exclusively on the platform from May 2.

Exploring Park Bo-gum's versatility: A star who shines across time and genreSouth Korean actor Park Bo-gum captivated audiences once more with his latest K-drama 'When Life Gives You Tangerines'. His journey from 'Reply 1988' to this latest role showcased his immense talent and versatility.

Zeenat Aman shares pics from hospital, reveals reason behind social media absenceVeteran actor Zeenat Aman has shared a heartfelt update post-hospitalisation, revealing her thoughts on life and social media. She reflects on her journey and the lessons learned during her recovery.

Nawazuddin Siddiqui reacts to Pahalgam attack: There's a lot of anger in usNawazuddin Siddiqui, during a film promotion event, expressed his solidarity with the victims of the Pahalgam attack by wearing a black band, highlighting his deep sense of anger and pain over the incident.

Nakuul-Jankee discuss dal-chawal parenting but their T-shirts steal the showActor Nakuul Mehta and his wife Jankee Parekh discussed their unique 'Dal-Chawal Parenting' approach on their podcast, while their T-shirts featuring characters from 'Sufi and Joker Bhaiya' become the highlight on social media.

Pakistani actor Mahira Khan condemns Pahalgam attack, deletes post laterPakistani actor Mahira Khan expressed her grief over the Pahalgam terror attack on Instagram. However, she deleted the post later.

When Nana Patekar made a producer wash dishes after serving him muttonIn a candid revelation, Paresh Rawal shared an amusing incident involving Nana Patekar and a producer. The story highlighted how Nana made the producer wash dishes after treating him to mutton.

Nani's HIT 3 gets A certificate, film all set for May 1 releaseTelugu star Nani's 'HIT: The Third Case' has cleared censorship with an 'A' certificate. The film is gearing up for a grand release in theatres on May 1.

Vir Das wraps record-breaking Mind Fool world tour, thanks fansVir Das has wrapped up his historic Mind Fool world tour, acclaimed as the largest by an Indian comedian. The tour not only showcased his wit to a global audience but also set the stage for his upcoming projects.

Thudarum review: Mohanlal's crime drama is good mix of thrills and punchesReleased-Fri Apr 25, 2025Thudarum film review: This crime drama, starring Mohanlal and Shobana, has been directed by Tharun Moorthy of Saudi Vellaka fame. Thudarum is an engaging film with a suspenseful storyline and some classic Mohanlal action.

Tahira Kashyap returns to work after cancer relapse: Picture abhi baaki haiTahira Kashyap, filmmaker and author, has returned to work after facing a breast cancer relapse. She shared this 'life update' on Instagram.

Ground Zero review: Emraan Hashmi elevates relevant story of Kashmir's silence, furyReleased-Fri Apr 25, 2025Ground Zero movie review: The film is about a soldier's spirit, his idea of patriotism, and his search for peace in the 'highly sensitive' area. Emraan Hashmi brings a relevant film that comments on Kashmir's shifting skies wounded by terrorism.

Kapkapiii teaser: Shreyas Talpade leads the Hindi remake of RomanchamTusshar Kapoor and Shreyas Talpade star in 'Kapkapiii', a Hindi remake of the Malayalam horror-comedy Romancham. Directed by late Sangeeth Sivan, the film releases on May 23, 2025.

Superboys of Malegaon OTT release: When and where to watch Reema Kagti's filmReema Kagti and Varun Grover's 'Superboys of Malegaon' began streaming on Prime Video. It stars Adarsh Gourav, Vineet Kumar Singh, Shashank Arora, and Anuj Singh Duhan.

Sarkeet trailer: Asif Ali headlines powerful tale of friendship and heartbreakAsif Ali, Divya Prabha and Deepak Parambol have come together for the heartwarming story of 'Sarkeet'. The trailer of the film was released on Thursday.

MAD Square OTT release: When and where to watch Nithin, Ram, Sangeeth's comedy film'MAD Square', the sequel to the hit campus comedy 'MAD', has made its OTT debut, after a successful theatrical run. It hit theatres on March 29.

Actor Kim Soo-hyun's fans hire lawyer to defend him against online harassmentFans of 'Queen of Tears' actor Kim Soo-hyun have appointed a lawyer to tackle the rising online abuse against the actor. The move aims to counter malicious comments and protect his reputation.

general news.headline: India forms 3-step plan on Indus water to stop flow to PakistanIn response to the Pahalgam terror attack by Pak-based terrorists, India has suspended the 1960 Indus Waters Treaty and halted the flow of Indus River water to Pakistan.

US will support India as it hunts down Pahalgam attackers: Tulsi GabbardThree days after terrorists killed 26 people in J&K's Pahalgam, US Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard condemned the Islamist terror attack and said that the US will support India as it hunts down the perpetrators.

Iran offers to play mediator between India, Pak as ties nosedive after J&K attackIran offered to mediate between India and Pakistan amid escalating tensions following a deadly terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir, with both countries taking retaliatory actions and the UN urging restraint.

Pony ride operator, who tourist claimed 'asked about religion', detained in J&KPahalgam terror attack: Police on Friday identified and detained a suspect after a video went viral on social media. Ekta Tiwari from Uttar Pradesh's Jaunpur claimed that the suspect asked her about her religion.

Amid tensions with Pakistan, what does India's 'Aakraman' exercise indicate?India's frontline fighter jets and IAF's top pilots took part in a large-scale military exercise amid heightened tensions with Pakistan. History has ample proof to show that such exercises have preceded conflicts.

Expel Pakistanis, Amit Shah directs states after India moves to cancel visasFollowing a high-level meeting with top officials, Union Home Minister Amit Shah instructed Chief Ministers of all states to take immediate steps to deport them, a day after India cancelled all existing visas for Pakistani nationals.

When India gave Pakistan war scare with 5 lakh troops on borderIn the winter of 1986-1987, India rolled out tanks and troops on a scale not seen in peacetime since World War II. India's Operation Brasstacks stunned Pakistan and made it scramble its military resources and reveal it had nuclear capability. As tensions soar after the Pahalgam massacre, here's a look at the India-Pakistan war that never was.

FBI arrests judge for obstructing anti-immigration opThe FBI said a Wisconsin judge was arrested for obstructing an anti-immigration operation, agency director Kash Patel said. However, Patel's X post on the arrest was later deleted.

How Pakistan's airspace ban will affect your international travelAs political tensions escalate between India and Pakistan following the Pahalgam terror attack, Islamabad has closed its airspace to Indian carriers. Indian travellers planning an international trip should brace for turbulence - not just in the sky, but in their wallets and travel plans as well.

India tests scramjet engine for over 1,000 seconds in hypersonic technology leapDefence Research & Development Laboratory (DRDL), a Hyderabad-based laboratory of Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO), successfully carried out a ground test of the Scramjet engine for more than 1,000 seconds.

Been doing US's dirty work…: On live TV, Pak minister's big admission on terrorThe remark, a vindication of India's long-held stand, comes at a time when India has held Pakistan indirectly responsible for the terror attack in Pahalgam.

As Pak sweats over India action, its citizens have a field day mocking themselvesAs India announced a raft of punitive measures against Pakistan, it seems that instead of losing sleep over the outcome, Pakistani citizens have taken to trolling themselves.

How the Vance family wore a bit of India during their 4-day trip hereFrom Usha Vance's red dress by a UK-based Indian designer to the Vance kids in lehengas and kurta sets, here's how the Vance family brought a touch of Indianness to their sartorial choices.

Air Force jet 'inadvertently drops non-explosive air store' on Madhya Pradesh homeThe Indian Air Force regretted the damage caused to a house in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri after one of its fighter jets inadvertently dropped a drop tank, which the force called a 'non-explosive aerial store' on the property.

Stop Wagah ceremony, it's not military parade but clownery, say some IndiansThe Border Security Force (BSF) has "scaled down" the Retreat Ceremony, popularly referred to as Beating Retreat, at the Attari-Wagah border after the Pahalgam terror attack. Some Indians are now demanding that the ceremony be stopped altogether, calling it "cringe showmanship" and "clownery".

Misleading narrative built on 'waqf by user': Centre defends law in Supreme CourtThe Centre argued that even if all waqfs, including 'waqf by user', had to be mandatorily registered under the original act of 1923, several private and government lands were claimed under 'waqf by user', leading to deprivation of valuable property rights of individuals and unauthorised claims over public properties.

Pak flag missing from Himachal Raj Bhavan's table on which Simla Accord was signedA day after Pakistan suspended the Simla Agreement of 1972 in the aftermath of the Pahalgam terror attack, the Pakistani flag on the historic table at the Raj Bhavan in Shimla, on which the pact was signed, went missing.

Passport lost, Indian stranded in Bahrain for 4 decades finally returns homeAn Indian, stranded in Bahrain for 42 years after losing his passport and travel documents, was reunited with his family in Kerala this week. Chandran Gopalan was reunited with his 95-year-old mother, but his father died in his absence. A Delhi-based NGO, Pravasi Legal Cell, helped in Gopalan's return home.

In Pahalgam attack, one Aadil caused bloodshed, another Adil took bulletsIn the Pahalgam terror attack, which claimed 26 lives, two Adils have come to the forefront. One opened fire on a group of tourists in the Baisaran meadow, while another sacrificed his life trying to save tourists and took three bullets in his chest.

J&K attack: Did intel about movements of LeT terrorists in Pahalgam go unnoticed?Pahalgam terror attack: India Today has learnt that intelligence input had warned of a Pakistan-based terror outfit instructing its local operatives to scout hotels in Pahalgam, where 26 people were killed in a terror attack.

Emraan Hashmi brings a relevant film that comments on Kashmir's shifting skies wounded by terrorism.

Top court scolds Rahul Gandhi over Savarkar remark: Your grandmother praised himThe Supreme Court on Thursday came down heavily on Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over his alleged objectionable remarks against freedom fighter Veer Savarkar, saying that the court won't allow such comments against freedom fighters and warning of suo motu action if repeated.

Floods or drought? Pak won't know what's coming now that Indus Treaty is shelvedUnder the Indus Waters Treaty, India was granted exclusive control over the eastern rivers - Ravi, Beas, and Sutlej - while Pakistan was given rights over the western rivers - Indus, Jhelum and Chenab - despite their origins in Jammu and Kashmir.

Phule review: Pratik-Patralekhaa's revolutionary film dimmed by dull storytellingReleased-Fri Apr 25, 2025'Phule' movie review: Director Ananth Mahadevan's 'Phule' delves into the lives of social reformers Jyotirao Phule and Savitribai Phule and their fight for women's education and caste discrimination. Despite its historical significance, the film struggles to engage the audience.

sports.headline: Watch: MS Dhoni wicket sparks contrasting emotions as Kavya Maran celebrates in ChepaukIPL 2025: While the rest of the Chennai crowd was silenced, SunRisers Hyderabad owner Kavya Maran celebrated MS Dhoni's wicket from the stands. CSK were bowled out for 154 in 19.5 overs on Friday.

Injured Umran Malik joins Kolkata Knight Riders squad to continue rehabIPL 2025: Fast bowler Umran Malik has joined the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) squad as a part of his rehabilitation. Earlier, the speedster was ruled out due to injury, after which Chetan Sakariya was roped in as his replacement.

CSK vs SRH: Ravindra Jadeja fails bat size test, hilariously slams it to reshapeIPL 2025, CSK vs SRH: Ravindra Jadeja hilariously slammed his bat on the ground after it failed the mandatory size test in Chennai. Jadeja managed 21 from 17 balls, failing to make use of a dropped catch on Friday.

MS Dhoni plays in 400th T20 match, joins rare clubChennai Super Kings captain MS Dhoni walked out to play the 400th match of his T20 career on Friday. MS Dhoni became the fourth player in the history of Indian cricket to achieve this landmark.

CSK vs SRH Live: Jadeja gets Klaasen as Sunrisers falter in chaseIPL 2025, CSK vs SRH Live Score: Hyderabad are losing their way in the run chase as Heinrich Klaasen falls to Ravindra Jadeja. CSK remain on top and are slowly applying the squeeze on the Sunrisers at the Chepauk.

Special moment: Dhoni recalls giving Gavaskar autographIPL 2025: MS Dhoni fondly recalled giving Sunil Gavaskar an autograph in 2023 when the Chennai Super Kings played their last game at Chepauk that season.

How much money do umpires earn in IPL and Indian cricket?The cricketers and their salaries in the IPL are always under scanner depending on their performances. But here's the lesser-known fact about how much the umpires earn per match in the Indian Premier League and domestic cricket.

Cummins hoping for batters to stand up, as SRH aim late comeback in IPLSunRisers Hyderabad captain Pat Cummins believes that the team can score big runs even if one or two more batters stand up in their matches in the IPL. Cummins' SRH are tottering at the bottom two spots of the league table.

Virat Kohli took early retirement from T20Is, could have played till 2026: RainaFormer India cricketer Suresh Raina believes Virat Kohli retired from T20 Internationals too early. Raina said Kohli could have easily continued playing until the 2026 T20 World Cup.

Jadeja has a lot of room for improvement while playing spin: Stephen FlemingChennai Super Kings (CSK) head coach Stephen Fleming has shared his thoughts about all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's batting against spin and said that he needs a lot of improvement.

Sanjay Bangar backs CSK to push SRH on last spot with win in ChennaiFormer India cricketer-turned commentator Sanjay Bangar feels Chennai Super Kings (CSK) will push Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) on last spot on the points table by defeating them in the upcoming fixture in Chennai.

CSK vs SRH: Chennai, Hyderabad battle it out to avoid last spotChennai Super Kings (CSK) will lock horns with Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) as both teams battle it out to avoid the ignominy of occupying the last spot on the points table. Both teams have won just two out of eight matches in the tournament so far.

Arshad Nadeem competing in India out of question: Neeraj on row over inviteNeeraj Chopra issued a statement clarifying that the invitation to Arshad Nadeem for the NC Classic event was extended well before the  Pahalgam terror attack. Expressing deep pain, Neeraj said he and his family have been deeply hurt by the wave of hate and abuse they've faced since the controversy erupted.

IPL 2025: Dewald Brevis to make CSK debut against SRH? Stephen Fleming reactsCSK head coach Stephen Fleming addressed the potential debut of Dewald Brevis ahead of their clash with Sunrisers Hyderabad on Friday, April 25. Brevis recently joined the five-time champions as a replacement player for the rest of the season.

Disgrace: Danish Kaneria to Pakistan Deputy PM over 'freedom fighters' remarkFormer Pakistan cricketer Danish Kaneria has slammed Pakistan's Deputy Prime Minister Ishaq Dar for bizarrely calling Jammu & Kashmir terrorists as 'freedom fighters'.

Tennis legend Roger Federer named honorary starter for Le MansTennis legend Roger Federer will act as the official starter for this year's 24 Hours of Le Mans sportscar race in June, organisers said on Thursday.

Really proud of the way we held ourselves under pressure: RCB head coachRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) head coach Andy Flower praised his team for holding their nerves under pressure against Rajasthan Royals (RR) and registering a thrilling 11-run win at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.

Rajasthan Royals let games slip, need to capitalise on crucial chances: Sandeep SharmaAfter Rajasthan Royals' 11-run loss to Royal Challengers Bengaluru, pacer Sandeep Sharma admitted that the team let the game slip away and missed key opportunities.

Andy Flower praises 'class operator' Josh Hazlewood after death over heroics vs RRRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) head coach Andy Flower was effusive in his praise for Josh Hazlewood following his match-winning performance against Rajasthan Royals (RR).

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".
